questions.questionText: The average of 8 numbers is 35. Find their sum.
The average of 6 numbers is 30. If one number 42 is excluded, what is the new average?
questions.explanation: Original sum = 30 × 6 = 180. After excluding 42: New sum = 180 - 42 = 138. New count = 5. New average = 138/5 = 27.6 ≈ 28. Answer: 28.

questions.questionText: Find the average of first 20 natural numbers.
questions.explanation: Average of first n natural numbers = (n+1)/2 = (20+1)/2 = 21/2 = 10.5. Answer: 10.5.

questions.questionText: Find the average of first 15 even natural numbers.
questions.explanation: Average of first n even numbers = n+1 = 15+1 = 16. Answer: 16.

questions.questionText: Average age of 20 boys is 12 years and average age of 30 girls is 10 years. Find the combined average age.
questions.explanation: Total age of boys = 20 × 12 = 240 years. Total age of girls = 30 × 10 = 300 years. Combined total = 540 years. Total count = 50. Average = 540/50 = 10.8 years. Answer: 10.8 years.

questions.questionText: A person travels from A to B at 40 km/h and returns from B to A at 60 km/h. What is the average speed for the entire journey?
questions.explanation: For equal distances, average speed = (2×v₁×v₂)/(v₁+v₂) = (2×40×60)/(40+60) = 4800/100 = 48 km/h. Answer: 48 km/h.

questions.questionText: The average of 5 numbers is 30. Four numbers are 25, 28, 32, 35. Find the fifth number.
questions.explanation: Total sum = 30 × 5 = 150. Sum of 4 numbers = 25 + 28 + 32 + 35 = 120. Fifth number = 150 - 120 = 30. Answer: 30.

questions.questionText: Average of 10 numbers is 50. If one number 60 is replaced by 80, what is the new average?
questions.explanation: Original sum = 10 × 50 = 500. Change = 80 - 60 = +20. New sum = 520. New average = 520/10 = 52. Alternatively: Increase per number = 20/10 = 2. New average = 50 + 2 = 52. Answer: 52.

questions.questionText: Average age of 5 people is 30 years. After 5 years, what will be the average age?
questions.explanation: When all members age by t years, average also increases by t years. New average = 30 + 5 = 35 years. Answer: 35 years.

questions.questionText: Find the average of all numbers from 10 to 50.
questions.explanation: For consecutive numbers, average = (First + Last)/2 = (10 + 50)/2 = 60/2 = 30. Answer: 30.

questions.questionText: Average of 20 observations is 35. Later found that one observation 65 was wrongly read as 56. Find the correct average.
questions.explanation: Wrong sum = 20 × 35 = 700. Correction = 65 - 56 = +9. Correct sum = 700 + 9 = 709. Correct average = 709/20 = 35.45. Answer: 35.45.

questions.questionText: A person drives at 40 km/h for 2 hours and at 60 km/h for 2 hours. What is the average speed?
questions.explanation: For equal time, average speed = (v₁ + v₂)/2 = (40 + 60)/2 = 50 km/h. Alternatively: Distance = 80 + 120 = 200 km, Time = 4 hours, Average = 200/4 = 50 km/h. Answer: 50 km/h.

questions.questionText: Average of first 10 numbers is 20, average of last 10 is 30. If average of all 18 numbers is 24, find average of middle 2 numbers.
Average age of 10 students is 20 years. A new student joins and the average becomes 19.5 years. Find the age of the new student.
questions.explanation: Original total = 10 × 20 = 200 years. New total = 11 × 19.5 = 214.5 years. New student age = 214.5 - 200 = 14.5 years. Answer: 14.5 years.

questions.questionText: Combined average of 50 students is 40. If average of 30 students is 35, find the average of the remaining 20 students.
Find the average of first 10 multiples of 7.
questions.explanation: Multiples: 7, 14, 21, ..., 70. Average = (First + Last)/2 = (7 + 70)/2 = 77/2 = 38.5. Alternatively: Average = 7 × (n+1)/2 = 7 × 5.5 = 38.5. Answer: 38.5.

questions.questionText: Average weight of 11 players is 50 kg. If a player weighing 55 kg is replaced by another, and the average increases by 1 kg, find the weight of the new player.
questions.explanation: New average = 50 + 1 = 51 kg. Total increase needed = 11 × 1 = 11 kg. Old player weight = 55 kg. New player weight = 55 + 11 = 66 kg. Answer: 66 kg.
